abstract: American Olympic swimmer Dana Vollmer will have to endure month apart from her young son in order to become first mother on United States swim team to win Olympic gold medal; has mixed feelings about family restrictions, which present new challenges as sport's increasing professionalization draws older athletes.

headline.print_headline: For U.S. Swimmer, Another Shot at Gold Requires a Personal Sacrifice
headline.main: Swimmer Dana Vollmer Seeks Another Gold Medal, This Time as a Mother

snippet: At 28, Vollmer is part of an older group of swimmers who have been able to stay in the sport because of professionalization, but training while caring for a 16-month-old poses logistical problems....
lead_paragraph: At 28, Vollmer is part of an older group of swimmers who have been able to stay in the sport because of professionalization, but training while caring for a 16-month-old poses logistical problems.
